column4: guys, I want to turn an old box, into (traffic manager, Firewall, Proxy, IDS ) appliance, for some friend Windows admins. Any recommended projects that do this kinda things ?
Hi, is it possible to install and use two DIFFERENT java versions on one Linux machine. And point applications to different versions. Please let me know asap ....
yes and yes
depends on which java kinds you're thinking
thnx a lot .... what do u mean ?
and depends on how clean you want them to be. like, it is not a good idea to install two different Sun java's
+ not possible with apt-get.. only binaries
but you can have gnu java and sun java installed and use both
I have no problem installing from non debs ... (from Sun downloads)
basically how do I point apps to a certain version ?
well... way i would do it is just issue a '/path/to/java -jar <app name>'
or write a small shell script that does that
what if the application uses java libs ..
shouldnt be an issue....
how will it be handled ?
are you running jar fiels?
the java binary iirc will handle the paths to the libs
no, I'm running large applications like oracle
this is as much as i know... you can try and see if it works
ok thanks a lot :)
you can also try #java
